column2: Abstract
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column right-indent font-largest hanged-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space string-abstract headchar-capital

column2: We describe the parsing system used at the Charles University (CUNI) for the Hindi Parsing
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: Shared Task 2012. We used the publicly available Malt Parser, which is highly config-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: urable. A substantial part of the paper describes the configuration that we selected. The
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: parser performs reasonably well in identifying the head nodes. The main weakness is in
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: labeling the dependency relations. We identify the most prominent error types, which
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: should help to improve the parsing accuracy in future.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: pro Hindi Parsing Shared Task 2012. Použili jsme veřejně dostupný nástroj Malt Parser,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: který poskytuje mnoho možností konfigurace. Podstatná část článku se zabývá právě
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: konfigurací, kterou jsme zvolili. Parser dosahuje dobré úspěšnosti při identifikaci
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: rodičovských uzlů. Jeho hlavní slabinou je značkování závislostních vztahů. Popisujeme
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: nejběžnější druhy chyb, což by mělo pomoci v budoucnosti zvýšit úspěšnost parseru.

column2: 1 Introduction
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column right-indent font-largest page-top numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Dependency parsing has gradually become standard way of parsing for many languages
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: during the past decade. There have been three multilingual shared tasks in dependency
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: parsing at CoNLL (2006, 2007 and 2009) and two focused on Indian languages, orga-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: nized at ICON (2009 and 2010). This work on parsing Hindi loosely follows from our
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: contribution to ICON (Zeman, 2009).
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail year headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2 Data
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The data provided are split to three parts: training, development and test. During the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: preparatory stage, we trained the parser on the training dataset and tested it on the de-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: velopment dataset. Then the blind test data were released. We retrained the parser on
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: both the training and the development datasets, and applied it to the test data. Note that
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: at this stage, we did not have access to the gold-standard syntactic annotation of the test
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: data and we could not measure the accuracy on the test set. Later on, after the official
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: results were announced, the full test set was released.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: From now on, we will refer to the original training data as dtrain, to the development data
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: as dtest, to the combination of dtrain+dtest as etrain and to the final test data as etest.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The data were provided in two file formats and two encodings of the Devanāgarī script.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period

column2: We work exclusively with the CoNLL data format (Buchholz and Marsi, 2006) and the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital

column2: UTF-8 encoding.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Two versions of morphological annotation were provided, corresponding to two tracks of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: the shared task: Gold and Auto. As suggested by its name, the Gold version contains more
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: information and more accurate information. In the Auto version, values of some token
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: attributes were assigned using automated tools, and values of the (many!) remaining
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: attributes were empty because no automatic tool was available to assign them.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: An example of one token from the Gold training data follows (including transliteration):

column2: Slightly more than 1% of the tokens in Hindi are attached non-projectively. As a distinct
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: feature of the Hyderabad treebank, there are special NULL nodes covering words deleted
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: from surface, e.g. in deficient coordinations, as in:
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-colon above-double-space above-line-space

column2: दीवाली के िदन जुआ NULL घर खेले ं मगर मे ं या होटल मे ं.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space tailchar-period

column2: dīvālī ke din juā khelẽ magar NULL ghar mẽ yā hoṭal mẽ.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column left-indent right-over aligned-line longer-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Diwali of day gambling play but [do-so] house in or hotel in
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column left-indent right-over aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital above-line-space

column2: “They do gamble on Diwali but they do so in house or in hotel.”
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail line-space above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The NULL nodes are present also in test input and it is not the task of the parser to
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: introduce them. Approximately 0.4% of all nodes are NULL nodes.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3 Parser
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: We use Malt Parser v. 1.7.1 <sup>1</sup> (Nivre et al., 2007). It is a deterministic shift-reduce parser
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space year headchar-capital

column2: where input words can be either put to the stack or taken from the stack and combined
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to form a dependency. The decision which operation (transition) to perform is made by
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: an oracle based on various features of the words in the input buffer and the stack. The
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: default machine learning algorithm used to train the oracle is a sort of SVM (support
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: vector machine) classifier (Cristianini and Shawe-Taylor, 2000).
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail year headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Malt Parser has participated in several CoNLL shared tasks in multilingual dependency
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: parsing (2006, 2007 and 2009), as well as in the ICON 2009 NLP tools contest in parsing
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 single-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: Indian languages. It achieves state-of-the-art accuracy (or close to it) for many languages,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: provided its settings, algorithm and feature space are optimized for the given language
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and dataset. Malt Parser is reasonably fast and it is open-source, freely available for
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: download.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Malt Parser provides several parsing algorithms. They differ in the data structures they
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: use, in the sets of transition operations they allow, and in the precedence of transition
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: types when converting a training tree to a sequence of transitions. The algorithms are as
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: follows: nivrestandard, nivreeager, covproj, covnonproj, stackproj, stackeager, stacklazy, pla-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: nar, 2planar. We need one of the non-projective algorithms because there are occasional
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: non-projective dependencies in the data. Based on dtest scores, we selected the stacklazy
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: algorithm.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Malt Parser is also highly configurable with respect to the features considered when se-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: lecting the next transition. Table 2 gives an overview of features that we used.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Training times depend on the number of features, thus it is much faster to train on the Auto
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: data than on the Gold data. Training Malt parser on the full etrain dataset takes about 2
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: hours in the Auto version and about 6 hours in the Gold version (tested on 2GHz 64bit Intel
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Xeon processors with 29GB RAM dedicated to the Java Virtual Machine). Parsing etest
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: took between 30 (Auto) and 45 (Gold) minutes. For the sake of quick probing experiments
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1 http://www.maltparser.org/
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 single-column left-indent right-indent font-smallest indented-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=2 xpos=4 ypos=9 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only page-bottom

column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: and input string. Features are numbered.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: we also used the subset of the first 1000 training sentences. With such limited training
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-lower

column2: corpus, accuracy dropped about 12 percent points down and processing times dropped to
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: 4 Results
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 column-bottom above-double-space above-line-space

column2: __Table 3__
column3: page=3 xpos=2 ypos=2 Table-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest column-top line-double-space line-space table-area column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 3: The official results as measured by the organizers of the shared task. UAS =
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 single-column full-justified column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital

column2: unlabeled attachment score; LA = labeling accuracy; LAS = labeled attachment score.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: 5 Error Analysis
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 single-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: In our assessment of typical error patterns we will focus on the Gold track. The (unlabeled)
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: attachment score is very high, which implies that it is difficult to pull out frequent errors.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Nevertheless, there is some evidence that coordinations, commonly perceived as hard to
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: parse, still correlate with errors in our data.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: If we break up tokens by their coarse part of speech, then the most successful classes
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: (in terms of finding their correct parent) will be PSP (postposition), VAUX (auxiliary
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 single-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: verb) and DEM (demonstrative), all scoring (almost) 100%. At the other end of the scale,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: coordinating conjunctions (CC) only achieve 83%. The conjunction serves as the head
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: node of the coordination. The parser probably feels uncertain about the type of the subtree
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of the conjunction, which makes it difficult to find the correct parent for the conjunction.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=3 xpos=4 ypos=9 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest indented-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only page-bottom

column2: Besides conjunctions, the second most difficult part of speech is RB (adverb of manner;
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column full-justified page-top headchar-capital tailchar-semicolon above-line-space

column2: 89%). If we look at word forms, again, conjunctions are most risky: और, िक, व.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail line-space tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Not surprisingly, attachments to the artificial root node are more difficult (96%) to recog-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: nize that dependencies inside the tree. For tree-internal arcs, length 1 has 99% accuracy
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and longer links decrease down to 92%.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: While the parser rarely confuses parent selection, its weakness lies in labeling of the
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: dependencies. The nature of the label set used in the Hyderabad treebank excludes certain
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: combinations of dependencies under one parent; in particular, there should not be two
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: siblings both labeled k1. However, the parser has only limited means of learning such
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: constraints. We cannot define a feature that would tell whether we already labeled k1
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: anything anywhere in the current tree. Labels with the lowest precision and recall are k1
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower
page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: coordination). Most of these are typical verb complements.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The most frequent label confusion occurred between r6-k2 (karma of a conjunct verb)
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: and r6 (possessive), presumably because both occur with the postposition का. Another
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: relatively frequent confusion is between k7p (location-place) and k7 (location other than
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: place).
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 6 Conclusion
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: We described our configuration of the Malt Parser used to parse Hindi part of the Hy-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 single-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: derabad Dependency Treebank ver. 0.51. Feature engineering is the key to success in
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: discriminative parsing. One of the main advantages of Malt Parser is that many differ-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ent features can be used to describe tokens in the various data structures of the parser.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Later in the paper, we evaluated the output of the parser and identified the most frequent
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: error types. Future work should focus on two separate problems: 1. How to improve
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: attachment of coordinations, and 2. How to improve labeling accuracy. For example,
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: coordinations might improve by introducing features that would better port the phrase
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: type to the higher levels. As for dependency labels, a self-standing tagger applied during
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: post-processing could be tested.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 single-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space
